multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an itchy rash on my right hand and dry, itchy feet.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've had the itchy rash on my right hand for about four months and the dry, itchy feet for about a year.
Do you notice any pattern or condition that worsens the itchiness or rash, such as exposure to certain materials or during certain activities?
Yes, the itchiness tends to get worse when I wear my steel-toed work boots and gloves at my job as a construction worker.
Have you had similar skin issues in the past or do you have any chronic skin conditions?
No, I don't have a significant past medical history or chronic skin conditions.
Is there a history of skin allergies or eczema in your family?
I didn't mention any family history of skin allergies or eczema.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for your symptoms? If so, what were they and did they provide any relief?
Yes, I have tried numerous over-the-counter hand creams and hydrocortisone cream, but they have not improved my symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Contact dermatitis.
